query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Io dico, seguitando, ch’assai prima 2 che noi fossimo al piè de l’alta torre, 3 li occhi nostri n’andar suso a la cima
query.error: **English:** 1 I say, continuing, that long before 2 we were at the foot of the high tower, 3 our eyes went up to the top
query.result: 1 Ic secge, fyligende, ðæt lange ær 2 ðe we wæron æt ðæs hean torres fot, 3 ure eagan ðær stigende wæron to ðæm tope

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 per due fiammette che i vedemmo porre, 5 e un’altra da lungi render cenno, 6 tanto ch’a pena il potea l’occhio tòrre.
query.error: **English:** 4 because of two flames that we saw placed there, 5 and another from afar giving a signal, 6 so that the eye could barely make it out.
query.result: 4 for ðam twam ligettum ðe we ðær gesawon settan, 5 and oðer feorran ðær onsende tacen, 6 swa ðæt ðæt eage hit uneaðe mæg geniman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 E io mi volsi al mar di tutto ’l senno; 8 dissi: «Questo che dice? e che risponde 9 quell’ altro foco? e chi son quei che ’l fenno?».
query.error: **English:** 7 And I turned to the sea of all wisdom; 8 I said: "What does this one say? and what does 9 that other fire answer? and who are those who made it?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Ed elli a me: «Su per le sucide onde 11 già scorgere puoi quello che s’aspetta, 12 se ’l fummo del pantan nol ti nasconde».
query.error: **English:** 10 And he to me: "Up over the murky waves 11 you can already make out what is expected, 12 if the smoke of the marsh does not hide it from you."
query.result: 10 And he to me: "Up ofer ða sweartan wægas 11 ðu miht ða gesion ðæt ðe sceal geweorðan, 12 gif ðe ðæs wætres smoc ðe ne let."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Corda non pinse mai da sé saetta 14 che sì corresse via per l’aere snella, 15 com’ io vidi una nave piccioletta
query.error: **English:** 13 Never did a bowstring shoot an arrow 14 that sped through the air as swiftly 15 as I saw a tiny boat
query.result: 13 Nefre sæġestreng strengde næfre swa 14 ðæt flæġe fromme folmum swa hrædlice, 15 swa ic ða geseah lytlu scip

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 venir per l’acqua verso noi in quella, 17 sotto ’l governo d’un sol galeoto, 18 che gridava: «Or se’ giunta, anima fella!».
query.error: **English:** 16 coming toward us across the water, 17 steered by a single boatman, 18 who shouted: "Now you have arrived, wicked soul!"
query.result: 16 cumað ofer wæġes stream us togeanes, 17 under anum scipwerige, 18 se ðær stefnede and ðus cwæð: "Nu ðu cume, sawulle!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 «Flegïàs, Flegïàs, tu gridi a vòto», 20 disse lo mio segnore, «a questa volta: 21 più non ci avrai che sol passando il loto».
query.error: **English:** 19 "Phlegyas, Phlegyas, you cry out in vain," 20 said my lord, "this time: 21 you will have no more of us than just passing by."
query.result: 19 "Flegëas, Flegëas, ðu gredest on idel," 20 cwæð min hlaford, "ðisne sið: 21 ne scealt ðu her on faran na mare ðonne ofer ðis wæter."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Qual è colui che grande inganno ascolta 23 che li sia fatto, e poi se ne rammarca, 24 fecesi Flegïàs ne l’ira accolta.
query.error: **English:** 22 What is he who listens to great deceit 23 that is done to him, and then grieves for it, 24 Phlegyas made himself in the gathered wrath.
query.result: 22 Hwilc is se ðe micelne facn gehyrð 23 ðe him gedon sie, and ðonne eft oncnæwð, 24 Flegius wearð on ðam mode gebolgen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Lo duca mio discese ne la barca, 26 e poi mi fece intrare appresso lui; 27 e sol quand’ io fui dentro parve carca.
query.error: **English:** 25 My guide descended into the boat, 26 and then he made me enter after him; 27 and only when I was inside did it seem laden.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Tosto che ’l duca e io nel legno fui, 29 segando se ne va l’antica prora 30 de l’acqua più che non suol con altrui.
query.error: **English:** 28 As soon as the leader and I were in the boat, 29 the ancient prow cuts through 30 the water more than it usually does with others.
query.result: 28 Swa swa ða ðeoden and ic on ðam treowe wæron, 29 ða gewat ða ealde stefn 30 ðurh ða wægas wel mare ðonne gewunelic ðurh oðre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Mentre noi corravam la morta gora, 32 dinanzi mi si fece un pien di fango, 33 e disse: «Chi se’ tu che vieni anzi ora?».
query.error: **English:** 31 While we were running up the deadly mountain, 32 in front of me appeared one covered in mud, 33 and he said: "Who are you that comes before your time?".
query.result: 31 Þa we up ða deorc stan stigon, 32 þa wæs beforan me an man eal bemired, 33 and cwæð: "Hwa eart ðu ðe her cymst ær ðinre tide?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 E io a lui: «S’i’ vegno, non rimango; 35 ma tu chi se’, che sì se’ fatto brutto?». 36 Rispuose: «Vedi che son un che piango».
query.error: **English:** 34 And I to him: "If I come, I do not remain; 35 but who are you, who have become so ugly?". 36 He answered: "See that I am one who weeps".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 E io a lui: «Con piangere e con lutto, 38 spirito maladetto, ti rimani; 39 ch’i’ ti conosco, ancor sie lordo tutto».
query.error: **English:** 37 And I to him: "With weeping and with mourning, 38 cursed spirit, may you remain; 39 for I know you, even though you are all filthy."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Allor distese al legno ambo le mani; 41 per che ’l maestro accorto lo sospinse, 42 dicendo: «Via costà con li altri cani!».
query.error: **English:** 40 Then he stretched both his hands to the wood; 41 whereupon the wary master pushed him away, 42 saying: "Away with you there with the other dogs!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Lo collo poi con le braccia mi cinse; 44 basciommi ’l volto e disse: «Alma sdegnosa, 45 benedetta colei che ’n te s’incinse!
query.error: **English:** 43 Then he put his arms around my neck; 44 he kissed my face and said: "Soul disdainful, 45 blessed is she who conceived you!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Quei fu al mondo persona orgogliosa; 47 bontà non è che sua memoria fregi: 48 così s’è l’ombra sua qui furïosa.
query.error: **English:** 46 That man was a proud person in the world; 47 there is no goodness that adorns his memory: 48 that is why his shade is so furious here.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Quanti si tegnon or là sù gran regi 50 che qui staranno come porci in brago, 51 di sé lasciando orribili dispregi!».
query.error: **English:** 49 How many are now held to be great kings up there 50 who here will lie like swine in the mire, 51 leaving behind them horrible contempt!
query.result: 49 Hu mænig cyning þær nu cwicu wunað 50 þegnas þegniað, þeoda hyrað, 51 þeáh þe hie wæron wælgifru ðuhte!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 E io: «Maestro, molto sarei vago 53 di vederlo attuffare in questa broda 54 prima che noi uscissimo del lago».
query.error: **English:** 52 And I: "Master, I would be very eager 53 to see him plunged into this broth 54 before we leave the lake."
query.result: 52 And ic: "Lareow, swiðe ic wille 53 ðæt ic hine geseah on ðisse brime 54 ær ðon ðe we ðisne mere forlæten."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Ed elli a me: «Avante che la proda 56 ti si lasci veder, tu sarai sazio: 57 di tal disïo convien che tu goda».
query.error: **English:** 55 And he to me: "Before the shore 56 lets itself be seen by you, you will be satisfied: 57 with such desire it is fitting that you feast."
query.result: 55 And he to me: "Ær ðe ðæt sæfearoð 56 læte ðe geseon, ðu byðst gefylled: 57 swylces wunsces gebyreð ðe brucan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Dopo ciò poco vid’ io quello strazio 59 far di costui a le fangose genti, 60 che Dio ancor ne lodo e ne ringrazio.
query.error: **English:** 58 After that, I saw that wretch 59 inflict such torment on the muddy people, 60 that I still praise and thank God for it.
query.result: 58 Æfter ðæm ic geseah ðone wreccan 59 ðone geswinc wyrcan ðæm fulum folce, 60 ðæt God ælmihtig lof and ðanc hæfð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Tutti gridavano: «A Filippo Argenti!»; 62 e ’l fiorentino spirito bizzarro 63 in sé medesmo si volvea co’ denti.
query.error: **English:** 61 Everyone shouted: "At Filippo Argenti!"; 62 and the bizarre Florentine spirit 63 turned on himself with his teeth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Quivi il lasciammo, che più non ne narro; 65 ma ne l’orecchie mi percosse un duolo, 66 per ch’io avante l’occhio intento sbarro.
query.error: **English:** 64 There we left him, and I will say no more about him; 65 but a sound of grief struck my ears, 66 so that I opened my eyes wide and stared ahead.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Lo buon maestro disse: «Omai, figliuolo, 68 s’appressa la città c’ha nome Dite, 69 coi gravi cittadin, col grande stuolo».
query.error: **English:** 67 The good master said: "O my son, 68 the city that is called Dite draws near, 69 with its grievous citizens, with its great throng."
query.result: 67 Se goda lareow cwæð: "O ðu, min sunu, 68 nu genealæceð seo burh ðe is Dite haten, 69 mid hefigum burgwarum, mid miclum werode."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 E io: «Maestro, già le sue meschite 71 là entro certe ne la valle cerno, 72 vermiglie come se di foco uscite
query.error: **English:** 70 And I: "Master, already its mosques 71 down there in the valley I discern, 72 crimson as if they had emerged from fire.
query.result: 70 And ic: "Lareow, ða his mustaðla 71 ðær binnan on ðam wæle ic geseo, 72 reade swa swa ða ðe of fyre cumen

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 fossero». Ed ei mi disse: «Il foco etterno 74 ch’entro l’affoca le dimostra rosse, 75 come tu vedi in questo basso inferno».
query.error: **English:** 74 that burns within them shows them red, 75 as you see in this lowest hell."
query.result: 73 wæron". And he cwæð to me: "Ðæt ece fyr 74 ðe ðær binnan ða afyrede ða awyð ða readan, 75 swa ðu on ðysum nyðemestan helle gesyhst".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Noi pur giugnemmo dentro a l’alte fosse 77 che vallan quella terra sconsolata: 78 le mura mi parean che ferro fosse.
query.error: **English:** 76 We arrived inside the deep ditches 77 that surround that desolate land: 78 the walls seemed to me to be made of iron.
query.result: 76 We ða becomon innan ða deopan dic, 77 ðe belimpað ða earme land: 78 ða weallas me ðuhton ðæt wæron iren.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Non sanza prima far grande aggirata, 80 venimmo in parte dove il nocchier forte 81 «Usciteci», gridò: «qui è l’intrata».
query.error: **English:** 79 Not without first making a wide circuit, 80 we came to a place where the strong boatman 81 shouted: "Get out here, this is the entrance."
query.result: 79 Nis ðæt ungemetlic ðæt ðu ær wide 80 cume to ðære stowe ðær se stiðra scipflot 81 clypode and cwæð: "Utgong nu her, ðis is inngang."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Io vidi più di mille in su le porte 83 da ciel piovuti, che stizzosamente 84 dicean: «Chi è costui che sanza morte
query.error: **English:** 82 I saw more than a thousand on the gates 83 raining down from heaven, who said angrily: 84 "Who is this who goes through the realm of the dead
query.result: 82 Ic geseah ða mare ðonne ðusend on ðam geatum 83 of heofenum astigne, ða ðus spræcon: 84 "Hwa is ðes ðe ðurh ðære deadra rice

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 va per lo regno de la morta gente?». 86 E ’l savio mio maestro fece segno 87 di voler lor parlar segretamente.
query.error: **English:** 85 without dying?" 86 And my wise teacher made a sign 87 of wanting to speak to them secretly.
query.result: 85 gæð ungesewenlic?" 86 And min wisa lareow dyde tacen 87 ðæt he wolde heom sprecan digollice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Allor chiusero un poco il gran disdegno 89 e disser: «Vien tu solo, e quei sen vada 90 che sì ardito intrò per questo regno.
query.error: **English:** 88 Then they restrained their great disdain a little 89 and said: "Come you alone, and let him go 90 who so boldly entered this realm.
query.result: 88 ða forleton heo ða heora miclan grame 89 and cwædon: "Cume ðu ana, and se gewite 90 ðe ðus dyrste ðurh ðis rice ferde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Sol si ritorni per la folle strada: 92 pruovi, se sa; ché tu qui rimarrai, 93 che li ha’ iscorta sì buia contrada».
query.error: **English:** 91 Only turn back along the foolish road: 92 try, if you know how; for here you will remain, 93 since you have been escorted through such a dark region».
query.result: 91 Sunu, gecyrre ðe on ðone gedwolan weg: 92 fandia, gif ðu cunne; for ðu her wunast, 93 ðe ðis dimme ðurh ðisne weg lædde».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Pensa, lettor, se io mi sconfortai 95 nel suon de le parole maladette, 96 ché non credetti ritornarci mai.
query.error: **English:** 94 Think, reader, if I was discouraged 95 at the sound of the cursed words, 96 for I did not believe I would ever return.
query.result: 94 Þence, ðu rædere, gif ic wæs afyrht 95 on ðam swege ðara yfelra worda, 96 ðæt ic næfre gelyfde ðæt ic ðanon eft cuman sceolde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 «O caro duca mio, che più di sette 98 volte m’hai sicurtà renduta e tratto 99 d’alto periglio che ’ncontra mi stette,
query.error: **English:** 97 "O dear leader of mine, who more than seven 98 times have given me reassurance and rescued 99 me from great peril that stood against me,
query.result: 97 "Eala, leof hlaford min, ðe ma ðonne seofon 98 siðum me hæfst sibbe geseald and genered 99 of earfoðum ðe me on innan stodon,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 non mi lasciar», diss’ io, «così disfatto; 101 e se ’l passar più oltre ci è negato, 102 ritroviam l’orme nostre insieme ratto».
query.error: **English:** 100 do not leave me," I said, "so undone; 101 and if passing further on is denied to us, 102 let us quickly retrace our steps together."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 E quel segnor che lì m’avea menato, 104 mi disse: «Non temer; ché ’l nostro passo 105 non ci può tòrre alcun: da tal n’è dato.
query.error: **English:** 103 And that lord who had led me there, 104 said to me: "Do not fear; for our passage 105 cannot be taken from us by anyone: it is granted by such a one.
query.result: 103 And se hlaford ðe ðær me lædde, 104 cwæð to me: "Ne ondræd ðe; forðæm ðe ure sið 105 ne mæg nan man us beniman: he is swa mihtig.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Ma qui m’attendi, e lo spirito lasso 107 conforta e ciba di speranza buona, 108 ch’i’ non ti lascerò nel mondo basso».
query.error: **English:** 106 But here wait for me, and comfort and nourish 107 my weary spirit with good hope, 108 for I will not leave you in the world below.
query.result: 106 Ac her abid ðu me, and ðone modsefan 107 frefra and fede mid ðære fægran hyhte, 108 ðæt ic ðe ne læte on ðissum lænan life.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Così sen va, e quivi m’abbandona 110 lo dolce padre, e io rimagno in forse, 111 che sì e no nel capo mi tenciona.
query.error: **English:** 109 Thus he goes away, and there he leaves me, 110 my sweet father, and I remain in doubt, 111 for yes and no contend in my head.
query.result: 109 Swa he forð gewat, and ðær me ana læfde, 110 min leofa fæder, and ic on wenan wæs, 111 ðæt gea and ne on ðam heafde wunnon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Udir non potti quello ch’a lor porse; 113 ma ei non stette là con essi guari, 114 che ciascun dentro a pruova si ricorse.
query.error: **English:** 112 I could not hear what he offered them; 113 but I did not stay there with them long, 114 for each one ran back inside, vying with the others.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Chiuser le porte que’ nostri avversari 116 nel petto al mio segnor, che fuor rimase 117 e rivolsesi a me con passi rari.
query.error: **English:** 115 They closed the doors, our adversaries, 116 in the breast of my lord, who remained outside, 117 and he turned to me with slow steps.
query.result: 115 Hi ða durað ða geata, ða gegnumena, 116 on ðæs hlafordes breostum, ðe ðær ute wæs, 117 and eft ongean me eode ða mid rincum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Li occhi a la terra e le ciglia avea rase 119 d’ogne baldanza, e dicea ne’ sospiri: 120 «Chi m’ha negate le dolenti case!».
query.error: **English:** 118 His eyes were fixed on the ground and his eyebrows 119 were shorn of all boldness, and he said in sighs: 120 "Who has denied me the sorrowful homes!".
query.result: 118 His eagan to ðære eorðan and ða eagbrywa 119 wæron berofene ælces baldlicean, and he cwæð on sichungum: 120 "Hwa mæ hæfð forwyrned ða dollican hus!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 E a me disse: «Tu, perch’ io m’adiri, 122 non sbigottir, ch’io vincerò la prova, 123 qual ch’a la difension dentro s’aggiri.
query.error: **English:** 121 And he said to me: "You, why are you afraid? 122 Do not be dismayed, for I will conquer the trial, 123 no matter who is defending himself inside.
query.result: 121 And he sæde to me: "Þu, for hwi ic me ondræde, 122 ne beo ðu afyrht, for ic wille oferwinnan ða costnunge, 123 swilc swa on ðære wearde innan ymbhogað."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Questa lor tracotanza non è nova; 125 ché già l’usaro a men segreta porta, 126 la qual sanza serrame ancor si trova.
query.error: **English:** 124 This arrogance of theirs is not new; 125 for they already used it at a more secret gate, 126 which is still found without a lock.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Sovr’ essa vedestù la scritta morta: 128 e già di qua da lei discende l’erta, 129 passando per li cerchi sanza scorta,
query.error: **English:** 127 Above it you see the dead inscription: 128 and already from here the steep path descends, 129 passing through the circles without a guide,
query.result: 127 Ufan him ðu gesihst ða deadan gewritu: 128 and nu ðanon ðurh ða stige stigeð, 129 ðurh ða circlus gað butan læde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 tal che per lui ne fia la terra aperta».
query.error: **English:** 130 such that the earth will be opened up for him.
query.result: 130 swa ðæt ðurh hine ða eorðan bið open.
